title: Chinese Government sponsors 'Construction and Management of Water Conservancy and Hydro-power Projects' training seminar for Nigerian engineers
description: In July 2018, the Chinese Government sponsored a training seminar in water conservation and hydropower management in Abuja. The training session was held in collaboration with the Nigerian Ministries of Budget and National Planning and Science and Technology. The seminar, entitled "Construction and Management of Water Conservancy and Hydro-power Projects" aimed to train 50 members of core engineering staff of relevant ministries in the aforementioned topics.   In 2016, Nigeria's Ministry of Science and Technology signed an memorandum of understanding with the International Centre for Small Hydropower. The training seminar falls under this MOU. The International Center on Small Hydro Power (ICSHP) is a public and non-profit institution directly under auspices of United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO), and China’s Ministries of Water Resources and Commerce.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government sponsors 'Construction and Management of Water Conservancy and Hydro-power Projects' training seminar for Nigerian engineers

# Description
In July 2018, the Chinese Government sponsored a training seminar in water conservation and hydropower management in Abuja. The training session was held in collaboration with the Nigerian Ministries of Budget and National Planning and Science and Technology. The seminar, entitled "Construction and Management of Water Conservancy and Hydro-power Projects" aimed to train 50 members of core engineering staff of relevant ministries in the aforementioned topics.   In 2016, Nigeria's Ministry of Science and Technology signed an memorandum of understanding with the International Centre for Small Hydropower. The training seminar falls under this MOU. The International Center on Small Hydro Power (ICSHP) is a public and non-profit institution directly under auspices of United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO), and China’s Ministries of Water Resources and Commerce.
justification: Project is focused on training and capacity building rather than direct infrastructure development or energy production
evidence: Training seminar for engineers, focus on knowledge transfer rather than physical project implementation

title: Chinese Government provides 47 scholarships to University of Jos students as part of the 'October 1st Scholarship for China-Nigeria Friendship' (linked to #86918)
description: In March 2018, the Chinese ambassador to Nigeria, Zhou Pingjian, presented 47 students at the University of Jos with scholarships. The scholarships were in honor of Nigeria and China's 47 years of diplomatic relations and their shared independence date of October 1st. Each scholarship was worth 100,000 naira.   Other recipient universities of the "October 1st Scholarship for China-Nigeria Friendship" are captured in linked umbrella ProjectID#86918.
staff_comments: Transaction amount recorded as 4,700,000 Naira as each of the 47 scholarships was worth 100,000 Naira.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides 47 scholarships to University of Jos students as part of the 'October 1st Scholarship for China-Nigeria Friendship' (linked to #86918)

# Description
In March 2018, the Chinese ambassador to Nigeria, Zhou Pingjian, presented 47 students at the University of Jos with scholarships. The scholarships were in honor of Nigeria and China's 47 years of diplomatic relations and their shared independence date of October 1st. Each scholarship was worth 100,000 naira.   Other recipient universities of the "October 1st Scholarship for China-Nigeria Friendship" are captured in linked umbrella ProjectID#86918.
justification: Project is focused on educational scholarships without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships provided to university students, education-focused initiative

title: Association of Chinese Women in Nigeria and Chinese Consulate General in Lagos donates equipment worth 12 million naira to Bethesda Home of the Blind
description: On November 17, 2018, the Association of Chinese Women in Nigeria in Nigeria and Chinese Consulate General in Lagos donated equipment worth 12 million naira to the Bethesda Home of the Blind. The donation was funded by the Consulate and implemented by the association. The donation was presented by Mao Zhao Xia, the wife of the Chinese consul general, and Zhou Jun, president of the association. According to media reports, the association stated the donation was made as part of the "China-Africa People-to-People Friendship Actions" initiative of the Chinese Government.   Items donated included generators, refrigerators, musical instruments, bags of rice, chairs, tables, cooking utensils, tissues, bed sheets, and digital voice recorders.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Association of Chinese Women in Nigeria and Chinese Consulate General in Lagos donates equipment worth 12 million naira to Bethesda Home of the Blind

# Description
On November 17, 2018, the Association of Chinese Women in Nigeria in Nigeria and Chinese Consulate General in Lagos donated equipment worth 12 million naira to the Bethesda Home of the Blind. The donation was funded by the Consulate and implemented by the association. The donation was presented by Mao Zhao Xia, the wife of the Chinese consul general, and Zhou Jun, president of the association. According to media reports, the association stated the donation was made as part of the "China-Africa People-to-People Friendship Actions" initiative of the Chinese Government.   Items donated included generators, refrigerators, musical instruments, bags of rice, chairs, tables, cooking utensils, tissues, bed sheets, and digital voice recorders.
justification: Project is a social welfare donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of equipment to a home for the blind, including generators and household items, as part of a people-to-people friendship initiative

title: Shandong Foreign Trade Vocational College and CGCOC Agricultural Development Co. Ltd sponsor agricultural training for 100 Nigerians
description: On July 24th, 2018, Shandong Foreign Trade Vocational College, and CGCOC Agricultural Development Co. Ltd held a 21 day agricultural training for Nigerians. The trainees were mostly officials drawn from federal and state ministries, departments and agencies, but also included participants from Nigerian agriculture businesses. The training was to focus on cultivation, breeding, and seed production techniques for Nigeria’s most cultivated crops; rice, maize and sorghum.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Shandong Foreign Trade Vocational College and CGCOC Agricultural Development Co. Ltd sponsor agricultural training for 100 Nigerians

# Description
On July 24th, 2018, Shandong Foreign Trade Vocational College, and CGCOC Agricultural Development Co. Ltd held a 21 day agricultural training for Nigerians. The trainees were mostly officials drawn from federal and state ministries, departments and agencies, but also included participants from Nigerian agriculture businesses. The training was to focus on cultivation, breeding, and seed production techniques for Nigeria’s most cultivated crops; rice, maize and sorghum.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural training and capacity building without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Agricultural training program for Nigerian officials and businesses, focus on cultivation and breeding techniques

title: Chinese Consulate General in Lagos donates classrooms to St. Patrick’s Nursery and Primary School
description: On November 15, 2018, the Chinese Consulate General in Lagos donated two blocks of classrooms and other items to St. Patrick’s Catholic Nursery and Primary School. Among those who attended the donation ceremony were Chinese Consul-General in Lagos Chao Xiaoliang, Moshood Mayegun, Lagos Island Government Education Authority Secretary; Dr. Oluremi Shopeyin, Executive Chairman, Lagos State Universal Basic Education Board; and Adetoyese Tijani, Chairman, Lagos Island West Government.   The donation was part of the "China-Africa People-to-People Friendship Action" initiative that resulted from the 2012 conference of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation.
combined_text:

The donation was part of the "China-Africa People-to-People Friendship Action" initiative that resulted from the 2012 conference of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation.
justification: Project focuses on educational infrastructure donation without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Donation of classroom blocks to primary school, part of people-to-people friendship initiative

title: Chinese Bureau of External Cultural Affairs of the Chinese Ministry of Culture and Tourism host training session in creative arts for African countries
description: The Chinese Bureau of External Cultural Affairs of the Chinese Ministry of Culture and Tourism held the an African Creative Design Training workshop. The training took place in Shenzhen from the May 6-13, 2018. 22 people from 8 African countries participated, including the Director General of the Nigerian National Council for Arts and Culture (NCAC), Otunba Olusegun Runsewe. The training included talks and discussions as well as visits to art and design industries in China.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Bureau of External Cultural Affairs of the Chinese Ministry of Culture and Tourism host training session in creative arts for African countries

# Description
The Chinese Bureau of External Cultural Affairs of the Chinese Ministry of Culture and Tourism held the an African Creative Design Training workshop. The training took place in Shenzhen from the May 6-13, 2018. 22 people from 8 African countries participated, including the Director General of the Nigerian National Council for Arts and Culture (NCAC), Otunba Olusegun Runsewe. The training included talks and discussions as well as visits to art and design industries in China.
justification: Project is a cultural exchange and training program with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Creative arts training workshop, cultural exchange focus, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Chinese Embassy to Niue grants $20,000 to Niue Premier
description: On July 27, 2018, Talaniue, a news company providing coverage in Niue, published an article detailing the 2018-2019 budget passed by the Niue Assembly, mentioning the Chinese Embassy donation of $20,000 USD to Premier Talagi of Niue to use at his discretion. The article states the donation aided in funding the Premier's visit to Hon Peters, some funding was given to the Village of Alofi South for their Show Day – where they hosted the Chinese Ambassador –, and some was used for senior students of Niue High School.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Embassy to Niue grants $20,000 to Niue Premier

# Description
On July 27, 2018, Talaniue, a news company providing coverage in Niue, published an article detailing the 2018-2019 budget passed by the Niue Assembly, mentioning the Chinese Embassy donation of $20,000 USD to Premier Talagi of Niue to use at his discretion. The article states the donation aided in funding the Premier's visit to Hon Peters, some funding was given to the Village of Alofi South for their Show Day – where they hosted the Chinese Ambassador –, and some was used for senior students of Niue High School.
justification: The donation is a general financial contribution without specific environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Funding used for Premier's visit, village event, and high school students - all social development purposes

title: China provides training for government officials from pacific island countries in 2018
description: In October 2018, the For­eign Affairs Office of the People’s Gov­ernment of Guangdong organized the 2018 Programme for Young Leaders from Pacific Island Countries, advancing pragmatic exchanges and co-operation with Pacific Island Coun­tries in Guangdong and across China. The training will last for 3 weeks and is planned to end on November 2, 2018. The participants of this program are civil serv­ants from Fiji, Vanuatu, Tonga, Cook Islands, Samoa, Niue and Federated States of Micronesia. The objective of this training was to link up greater details of co-opera­tion and strengthen the relationship between Guangdong Province and Pa­cific Island countries.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China provides training for government officials from pacific island countries in 2018

# Description
In October 2018, the For­eign Affairs Office of the People’s Gov­ernment of Guangdong organized the 2018 Programme for Young Leaders from Pacific Island Countries, advancing pragmatic exchanges and co-operation with Pacific Island Coun­tries in Guangdong and across China. The training will last for 3 weeks and is planned to end on November 2, 2018. The participants of this program are civil serv­ants from Fiji, Vanuatu, Tonga, Cook Islands, Samoa, Niue and Federated States of Micronesia. The objective of this training was to link up greater details of co-opera­tion and strengthen the relationship between Guangdong Province and Pa­cific Island countries.
justification: Project focuses on training and capacity building for government officials, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Training program for civil servants, focus on cooperation and relationship building

title: China Provides Fisheries Training Course to Pacific Islands Country in 2018
description: From November 28 to December 18, 2018, fisheries officers from pacific island countries participated a training on aquaculture farming skills and culturing techniques for marine and freshwater species, provided by China's Guangdong province. Officials from Cook Islands, Tonga, Samoa, Fiji, Solomon Islands and Papua New Guinea participated in the training course. The training programme opened at the Guangdong Provincial Vocational School of Oceanographic Engineering. The trainees toured several aquaculture and fish processing plants during the course.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
China Provides Fisheries Training Course to Pacific Islands Country in 2018

# Description
From November 28 to December 18, 2018, fisheries officers from pacific island countries participated a training on aquaculture farming skills and culturing techniques for marine and freshwater species, provided by China's Guangdong province. Officials from Cook Islands, Tonga, Samoa, Fiji, Solomon Islands and Papua New Guinea participated in the training course. The training programme opened at the Guangdong Provincial Vocational School of Oceanographic Engineering. The trainees toured several aquaculture and fish processing plants during the course.
justification: Project focuses on skills training and knowledge transfer in fisheries, without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Fisheries training course, aquaculture farming skills, marine and freshwater species, vocational training focus

title: ICBC contributes $170.7 million to syndicated loan for Duqm Refinery Construction Project
description: In September 2018, Duqm Refinery and Petrochemical Industries Company LLC (DRPIC or OQ8) — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture between Omani Oil Company S.A.O.C (OOC) [an Omani state-owned enterprise (SOE)] and Kuwait Petroleum International (KPI) [a subsidiary of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation] — signed a $4.61 billion debt financing package with the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) and 28 other financial institutions for the Duqm Refinery and Petrochemical Industries Company (DRPIC) for the Duqm Refinery Project. The members of the lending syndicate include ICBC, National Bank of Kuwait, Kuwait Finance House, Crédit Agricole, Corporate and Investment Bank, KfW IPEX-Bank, Société Générale, Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, Bank Muscat, Boubyan Bank, Banco Santander, Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ, Ltd, BNP Paribas, Commercial Bank of Kuwait, Bank Dhofar, Qatar National Bank, APICORP, Natixis, Standard Chartered Bank, National Bank of Oman, Warba Bank, Korea Development Bank, Credit Suisse, HSBC, Intesa Sanpaolo, UBI Banca, Ahli United Bank Kuwait, Bank Sohar, and Ahli Bank Oman. The $4.61 billion senior debt financing package consisted of six syndicated loan facilities, including:  (1) a $1.43 billion International Commercial Facility; (2) a $490 million Onshore Commercial Facility; (3) an $890 million Islamic Facility; (4) a $700 million UK Export Finance (UKEF) Covered Facility; (5) a $500 million Compañía Española de Seguros de Crédito a la Exportación (CESCE) Covered Facility; and (6) a $600 million Korea Export Import Bank (K-EXIM) Covered and K-EXIM Direct Facilities.  The commercial bank facility has a scheduled final maturity date in 2034, the onshore commercial bank facility has a scheduled final maturity date in 2037, the Islamic bank facility has a scheduled final maturity date in 2034, and the ECA facilities each have scheduled final maturity dates in 2035. As of December 31, 2020, $3.261 billion (OMR 1.3 million) was outstanding (in aggregate) under the loan facilities and $1.349 billion (OMR 526 million) was available for drawing. The other borrowing terms that applied to these loan facilities are unknown. However, it is known that the loan facilities were secured by (i.e. collateralized against) (1) DRPIC's assets, (2) land, (3) offshore accounts, (4) other unspecified rights ICBC was a mandated lead arranger on at least one of these facilities and contributed $170.7 million to at least one facilities (most likely the USD-denominated $1.43 billion International Commercial Facility). The total cost of the Duqm Refinery Construction Project is $8.28 billion and it is being financed according to a debt-to-equity ratio of 55:45.  The purpose of the project is to construct an oil refinery in the Duqm Special Economic Zone, which is strategically located outside the Straits of Hormuz to export refined products to Europe, Africa and the Far East. Duqm Refinery is actually located at three sites within (SEZAD), two at Duqm and one at Ras Markaz. The Duqm site will be the location of a complex refinery, on-site utilities, infrastructure, storage and a product export terminal located at the Port of Duqm. At Ras Markaz, a crude storage facility will be located at 80 kilometers from the refinery. Additionally, a pipeline will be constructed to transport crude oil from the crude storage facility to the refinery.  Spain's Tecnicas Reunidas Corporation and South Korea's Daewoo Engineering and Construction Corporation are the general contractors responsible for project implementation, but multiple companies are involved as subcontractors (including China National Chemical Engineering Third Construction Co. Ltd., which is also known as CNCEC). In August 2017, OOC and KPI awarded three EPC packages for Duqm: a $2.75 billion contract for the refinery's main process unit awarded to Spanish firm Tecnicas Reunidas in consortium with Daewoo Engineering & Construction of South Korea; a contract for the construction of utilities and offsite facilities awarded to a joint venture between UK's Petrofac and South Korea's Samsung Engineering, and a contract for the construction of a product storage and export terminal to Italy's Saipem International Samsung and Petrofac. In October 2018, a $50.6 million EPC sub-contract was awarded to Galfar Engineering and Contracting. CNCEC won an RMB 567 million (USD 80.58 million) EPC contract in August 2019. Site preparation was undertaken by Galfar Contracting Co. during 2015-2016.  Project implementation commenced in June 2018. As of December 2019, the project had achieved a 45% completion rate. As of December 25, 2020, the overall progress achieved on the Duqm Refinery project was 76.7 percent, while the engineering progress achieved was 99.3 percent, the procurement progress achieved was 94.7 percent, and the construction progress achieved was 62.1 percent. As of December 25, 2020, the project had achieved 93.7 million safe man-hours and was projected to reach completion in 2022. Upon completion, the refinery is expected to have capacity to process 230,000 barrels of oil per day (bpd). It is designed to process a range of blended crude oils. The refinery is configured as a full-conversion hydrocracker/coking facility. Moreover, the refinery is designed to have an operational life of at least 25 years and will produce diesel and jet/kerosene, meeting international specifications (Euro V and Jet A-1 respectively) as its primary products. The refinery will also produce naphtha and LPG. The products of the refinery will be sold to Oman Trading International Ltd (OTI) (50%) and Kuwait Petroleum Corporation (KPC) (50%) under long term off-take agreements.  As of November 2022, the project reached a completion rate of 96% and is set to be complete by the end of 2023.
staff_comments: 1. ICBC refers to the ‘commercial loan’ as having a 16 year maturity and the ‘ECA loan’ as having a 17 year maturity. For the time being, AidData assumes that the ICBC loan has a 16 year maturity.2. The Chinese project title is 阿曼杜库姆炼油厂项目 or 杜库姆炼油厂建项目.3. Duqm Refinery and Petrochemical Industries Company (DRPIC) is an LLC that was established under the laws of the Sultanate of Oman to develop, construct, own, and operate an export refinery plant within the Special Economic Zone at Duqm (SEZAD).4. UK Export Finance (UKEF), Spanish Export Credit Agency (CESCE), and the Export-Import Bank of Korea (KEXIM) provided guarantees. Oman Oil and KPE have entered into completion guarantees with the lenders which in turn are guaranteed by the Government of Oman and KPC, respectively. According to ICBC, ‘[t]he Completion Guarantee and Project completion conditions are robust mitigants to the exposure of the Secured Credit Facilities providers to completion risk; The Ministry of Finance and KPC will respectively guarantee the Completion Guarantee obligations of each of Oman Oil and KPE; Customary project finance account structure with foreign currency revenues deposited into secured offshore accounts, with withdrawals subject to a traditional cash flow waterfall; and there is a comprehensive security package.’5. An ICBC sources suggests that it contributed to (1) an export credit agency (ECA) loan for the purpose of constructing the refinery and (2) a commercial loan for the purpose of repaying shareholders' capital. This issue warrants further investigation.6. OOC and KPI were advised by Crédit Agricole – financial, and Allen & Overy – legal. The lenders were advised by: Latham & Watkins – legal. The ECAs were advised by: Greengate – financial.7. Omani Oil Company S.A.O.C (OOC) and Kuwait Petroleum International (KPI) each have a 50% ownership stake in DRPIC (OQ8). In 2012, OOC established DRPIC (OQ8) as a 50:50 joint venture with International Petroleum Investment Company PJSC of Abu Dhabi which subsequently sold its share to KPE, a wholly owned subsidiary of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation, the national oil company of Kuwait.8. CNCEC began work on November 6, 2019 and was scheduled to complete works by September 7, 2021.9. Under the finance documentation, OOC and KPE each committed to provide a minimum of $1.834 billion in equity contributions prior to the satisfaction of the completion conditions under the financing. This equity commitment may be satisfied through the contribution of share capital and shareholder loans to DRPIC (OQ8), or through the use of DRPIC (OQ8) pre-completion revenues to fund development costs.
combined_text:

justification: Primary purpose is construction of an oil refinery, which directly supports fossil fuel production and processing
evidence: Construction of oil refinery with capacity to process 230,000 barrels per day, production of diesel, jet fuel, naphtha, and LPG, designed for 25-year operational life
